verse:
जयति तेऽधिकं जन्मना व्रज: श्रयत इन्दिरा शश्वदत्र हि । 
दयित द‍ृश्यतां दिक्षु तावकास्त्वयि धृतासवस्त्वां विचिन्वते ॥

vedabase.translation: The gopīs said: O beloved, Your birth in the land of Vraja has made it exceedingly glorious, and thus Indirā, the goddess of fortune, always resides here. It is only for Your sake that we, Your devoted servants, maintain our lives. We have been searching everywhere for You, so please show Yourself to us.
vedabase.purport: Those who are familiar with the art of chanting Sanskrit verses will be able to appreciate the especially exquisite Sanskrit poetry of this chapter. Specifically, the poetic meter of the verses is extraordinarily beautiful, and also, for the most part, in each line the first and seventh syllables begin with the same consonant, as do the second syllables of all four lines.

terms.व्रज: Vraja (the place where Lord Krishna spent his childhood)

terms.jayati te adhikam janmanā: you are greater than all beings
terms.vrajaḥ śrayate indirā śaśvat: the cowherd community is ever protected by Indra
terms.dikṣu tāvakāḥ tvayi dhṛta asavaḥ: these your devotees are intoxicated by you
